benchmark_details.name: CERD (Chinese Essay Rhetoric Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: CERD is a manual annotated comprehensive Chinese rhetoric dataset that consists of 4 coarse-grained and 23 fine-grained categories across both form and content levels, aimed at rhetorical understanding and generation in essays.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve the understanding and generation of various rhetorical devices in essays, and to provide a benchmark for future research on rhetoric.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset collected from students may include typographical errors due to limited language proficiency.

data.source: Constructed from essays written by primary and middle school students in real educational settings.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by annotators with backgrounds in Education or Chinese Language and Literature.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the predictions of the model compared to the ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in metrics indicate better performance of the models.
methodology.validation: The dataset is validated through inter-annotator agreement and assessments of task performance.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data anonymization procedures were adopted to remove personal information of the authors.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: All essays in CERD have been authorized for use.
